IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration specifies the ingredient (chocolate chips) and its preparation (coating in flour) but does not provide exact measurements for either the chips or the flour, placing it at a medium level of detail.

InstructionDetail.label: Instruction Detail
InstructionDetail.explanation: The instruction offers a specific action (coating the chocolate chips in flour) to prevent a common baking issue (chips sinking), showing a more detailed level of instruction that goes beyond a simple mix or add.

ExplanationLevel.label: Explanation Level
ExplanationLevel.explanation: This narration briefly explains the purpose behind the action (to prevent sinking) without delving into the science or mechanics behind why this method works, thus providing some level of explanation.

Personalization.label: Personalization
Personalization.explanation: The narrative is straightforward and lacks personal anecdotes, tips beyond the basic technique, or individual adaptation suggestions, classifying it as having no personalization.

IngredientDetail.label: Ingredient Detail
IngredientDetail.explanation: The narration specifies using a tablespoon of the flour mixture and mentions the quantity of blueberries (one-and-a-half cups), indicating a high level of detail about the ingredients.

InstructionDetail.label: Instruction Detail
InstructionDetail.explanation: This narration provides detailed steps on reserving a tablespoon of flour mixture and then using it to mix with the blueberries, demonstrating a comprehensive level of instruction detail.

ExplanationLevel.label: Explanation Level
ExplanationLevel.explanation: While the narration lacks an explicit explanation of why this technique is used, the implication is there (to mix the flour with blueberries), providing some level of 'why' behind the action, albeit not extensively.

Personalization.label: Personalization
Personalization.explanation: The narration sticks strictly to the instructions without including any personal anecdotes, tips beyond the scope of the direct instructions, or personalized touches, indicating no personalization.
